briefTitle: Effect of Valsartan Compared to Enalapril on Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure in Children With High Blood Pressure
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-group, Evaluation of 12 Weeks of Valsartan Compared to Enalapril on Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure in Children 6 to 17 Years of Age With Hypertension
summary: The purpose of this 12-week active controlled trial is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of valsartan 80/160/320 mg (weight stratified) compared with enalapril 10/20/40 mg (weight stratified) on sitting systolic blood pressure (SSBP) in 6 - 17 year old children with hypertension (SSBP ≥ 95th percentile for age gender and height).

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure (MSSBP)
